description: Break clumps into pebbles. The pebbles must be balls or rblocks to be broken (see the ball clump and rblock clump commands). The pebbles are returned to their original containers and contacts are retained with other pieces. The inertial properties of the pebbles are recomputed. The range is used to determine which clumps are to be broken. Clumps without pebbles are deleted, and the inertial properties of clumps with pebbles remaining are recomputed.

keywords.name: pebbles
keywords.description: Specify one or more pebbles to be broken by ID. The pebbles must be balls or rblocks. Cannot be given with the plane keyword

keywords.name: plane
keywords.description: Specify that a plane is used to identify pebbles to be broken. Cannot be given with the pebbles keyword

sub_keywords.name: point
sub_keywords.description: Specify a point on the plane

keywords.name: combine
keywords.description: Combine the broken pebbles into a new clump. All contacts with the broken pebbles are retained. Default: false

keywords.name: inertia-tolerance
keywords.description: Specify the tolerance for computing the inertial attributes of the remaining or new clumps. Values between 0.00005 and 1 are accepted. Default: 0.01. Lower values produce more accurate inertial attribute estimates

notes: Pebbles must be balls or rblocks to be broken
Pebbles are returned to their original containers (balls or rblocks)
Contacts are retained with other pieces after breaking
Clumps without pebbles are deleted after breaking
Inertial properties are recomputed for remaining clumps
Cannot use both pebbles and plane keywords simultaneously

examples.description: Break clump 100 by removing pebbles with IDs 1, 2, and 3

examples.command: clump break plane normal (0,0,1) point (0,0,5) range group 'mygroup'
examples.description: Break clumps in 'mygroup' using a horizontal plane at z=5

examples.command: clump break pebbles 5 6 combine true inertia-tolerance 0.001 range id 50
examples.description: Break clump 50 by removing pebbles 5 and 6, then combine remaining pebbles into a new clump with high precision (0.1% tolerance)

examples.command: clump break plane normal (1,0,0) point (10,0,0) combine false range all
examples.description: Break all clumps using a vertical plane at x=10, do not combine broken pieces

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('clump break ...') - Python SDK cannot directly break clumps into pebbles
